img.alt: School-based feeding sites to operate on 3-hour delay Monday

a.span: School-based feeding sites to operate on 3-hour delay Monday

div.p: Please visit one of the school-based feeding sites from 2:00 p.m. until 4:00 p.m. on Monday.

a.title: Go to comments for School-based feeding sites to operate on 3-hour delay Monday

a.span: Convoy of Hope mobile distribution event Saturday for families in need

div.p: Volunteers will distribute 40,000 lbs of food, cleaning supplies, and hygiene products to families in need.

a.title: Go to comments for Convoy of Hope mobile distribution event Saturday for families in need

a.span: Timberland High names Gregory Wright head football coach

div.p: Wright will vacant his position at Denmark-Olar High School to move back to the area he calls home.

a.title: Go to comments for Timberland High names Gregory Wright head football coach

div.p: We want everyone, in all of our communities, to know how much we appreciate your support!

a.title: Go to comments for THANK YOU!

img.alt: still from defvon forest elem video

a.span: Schools show virtual support for autism awareness

div.p: BCSD schools showed support for World Autism Awareness Day by posting photos and videos of students and staff sporting blue t-shirts.

a.title: Go to comments for Schools show virtual support for autism awareness

div.p: Westview Middle students were challenged to create simple machines from items they had available in their homes during extended eLearning. Their creations made of silverware, candy, toys and etc. were amazing!

a.title: Go to comments for Problem Solvers: DIY simple machines
Subscribe to RSS Feed - District News UPDATES
a.span: Subscribe to RSS Feed - District News UPDATES

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });
$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

a.span: Students at Cross Middle/High to create museum

div.p: There’s a vision of the future at Cross Middle/High School, and it includes a state-of-the-art focus on the past.

a.title: Go to comments for Students at Cross Middle/High to create museum

div.p: On the campus of Sangaree Middle, students with special needs and their general education peers team up to make coffee, hot chocolate and cider for faculty and staff members at the school. The weekly activity has become a big business and one of the sweetest things you'll ever witness.

a.title: Go to comments for Exceptional Coffee at Sangaree Middle

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: New hands-on learning opportunity coming to Bowen's Corner Elementary

a.span: New hands-on learning opportunity coming to Bowen's Corner Elementary

div.p: Bowen’s Corner Elementary is one of 16 schools across Virginia and North and South Carolina that is receiving a solar panel as part of the Solar for Students Program, which aims to give students a hands-on experience with solar energy, courtesy of a grant that art teacher Lauren Rice applied for

a.title: Go to comments for New hands-on learning opportunity coming to Bowen's Corner Elementary

a.span: Educators are Innovators: Students take ownership of work at Berkeley Intermediate

div.p: Authentic assessments and student led conferences are new to Berkeley Intermediate this year, and allow for students to take ownership of their learning.

a.title: Go to comments for Educators are Innovators: Students take ownership of work at Berkeley Intermediate

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

a.span: Macedonia Middle cultivating a culture of contagious creativity

div.p: From lessons involving vertical hydroponic gardens to STEAM activities involving student choice boards, 3D printers and virtual reality/augmented reality headsets, what’s happening in classrooms at Macedonia Middle is far from what students experienced in the 80s and 90s.

a.title: Go to comments for Macedonia Middle cultivating a culture of contagious creativity

a.span: Multiage program at College Park Elementary is "something magical"

div.p: ﻿Teachers and administrators at College Park Elementary have found a flexible approach to meet the needs of the school’s diverse group of learners.

a.title: Go to comments for Multiage program at College Park Elementary is "something magical"

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.p: Westview Middle students were challenged to create simple machines from items they had available in their homes during extended eLearning. Their creations made of silverware, candy, toys and etc. were amazing!

a.title: Go to comments for Problem Solvers: DIY simple machines

div.p: In this episode of Problem Solvers, students at Sedgefield Middle create ramps from scraps and books to make cars travel faster and farther.

a.title: Go to comments for Problem Solvers: Making the car "ZOOM"

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

a.title: BCSD Innovates. News and information about innovation in Berkeley County School District.
Go to comments for BCSDinnovates 2

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: The Berkeley County Board of Education meets the second and fourth Tuesday of every month at 5:30 p.m. in the Boardroom located at 107 E. Main Street in Moncks Corner (except as noted on October 22 and March 10). Board meetings are open to the public and citizens are encouraged to attend. There is an opportunity for "Citizen Comments" at the start of each meeting.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: Berkeley County School District’s Division of Academics and Innovation is committed to providing a future focused vision on education through next generation learning. We are dedicated to ensuring that all students are college, career and life-ready when they graduate from BCSD by incorporating approaches that are rooted in rigorous college and career-ready outcomes and that integrate the following:
Personalized Learning- Approaches that individualize learning for each student based on their individual strengths.
Competency-Based Learning- Approaches that allow students to advance along a learning continuum based on mastery.
Deeper-Learning- Approaches that enable the 4 Cs- critical thinking, creativity, collaboration, and communication.
Blended Learning- Approaches that employ multiple methods of content delivery through the infusion of technology to enable flexibility in time, place, path, and pace.
Student-Centered Learning- Approaches that enable students to have voice and choice over their learning.

div.div: The Berkeley County School District is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, sex, color, religion, disabilities, national origin, military status, immigrant status, or English-speaking status. Inquiries regarding non-discrimination policies should be made to the Director of Human Resources. -- The content of external links are not controlled by Berkeley County School District. While school staff members review links when they are inserted on district or school pages, the contents of the linked page can change at any time. Furthermore, school staff members may not have reviewed links found within the linked page. If you find linked content that you consider inappropriate, please contact the Berkeley County School District Office of Technology or Office of Communications and Community Engagement. Explore external links at your own risk.
